sentence.Network_en: "A deal!" she said contemptuously, "I hate all deals."
sentence.Network_cn: “交易！”她鄙夷地说，“我厌恶一切交易。”

sentence.Network_en: He dismissed my argument contemptuously as not worth refuting.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把我的论证轻蔑地一笔抹杀,认为不值一驳.
她对他们的抱怨不屑一顾.

list.abs: 用集装箱运输；集装箱化contamination污染；沾污contemptuous damages微额赔偿金Content
backwardness in her family towards him is due to his cold and contemptuous behavior .她家里人对他的迟疑归咎于他冷淡轻蔑的行为。
the empty empire's emperoran attempt to tempt the contemptuous man .空虚帝国的皇帝试图诱惑那个轻蔑的人。
derisive or contemptuous sound made by vibrating the extended tongue and the lips while exhaling ., 震动突出的舌头和嘴唇 , 同时呵气发出表示责怪或轻蔑的声音.

entry.def: If you are contemptuous of someone or something, you do not like or respect them at all.

example.ex: He was contemptuous of private farmers...
He's openly contemptuous of all the major political parties...

means.word_mean: 1. without respect; in a disdainful manner;

auth_sentence.content: Dylan mutters the name again, contemptuously, Dominic Be-un.

auth_sentence.content: If you didn't, you did not glare contemptuously at people who did.
